docs.title: Welcome to Peek Stash Browser
docs.text:
A modern, responsive web application for browsing and managing your Stash media library with advanced filtering, authentication, and adaptive video streaming.

  • Quick Start

    Get up and running in minutes with Docker or unRAID

    Installation Guide

  • Video Streaming

    Real-time HLS transcoding with multiple quality options

    Video Playback

  • Playlists

    Create, manage, and play playlists with shuffle and repeat modes

    Playlist Guide

  • Developer Docs

    Comprehensive development documentation and API reference

    Development Setup

docs.title: Core Functionality
docs.text:
• Secure Authentication - JWT-based authentication with role management (admin/user)
  • Modern Interface - Beautiful, responsive React UI with theme support
  • Advanced Search & Filtering - Comprehensive filtering across performers, scenes, studios, and tags
  • Intelligent Sorting - Multiple sorting options for all content types
  • Mobile Ready - Fully responsive design optimized for all devices

docs.title: Video Streaming
docs.text:
• Adaptive Transcoding - Real-time HLS transcoding with multiple quality options (720p/480p/360p)
  • Smart Playback - Direct play when possible, seamless fallback to transcoding
  • Quality Controls - Automatic and manual quality selection
  • Session Management - Intelligent cleanup of transcoding resources

docs.title: Content Management
docs.text:
• Detailed Views - Enhanced detail pages for performers, studios, and tags
  • Rich Metadata - Display ratings, statistics, and comprehensive information
  • CRUD Operations - Full create, read, update, delete capabilities
  • Theme Integration - Consistent theming across all components

docs.title: Playlist Features
docs.text:
• Create & Organize - Build custom playlists of your favorite scenes
  • Shuffle Mode - Randomize playback order with Fisher-Yates algorithm
  • Repeat Modes - None, Repeat All, or Repeat One
  • Drag & Drop - Intuitive reordering with HTML5 drag-and-drop
  • Status Cards - See playlist context when viewing scenes

docs.title: Architecture
docs.text:
Peek uses a modern single-container architecture for production deployments:

  • Frontend: React 19 app served by nginx on port 80
  • Backend: Node.js/Express API server on port 8000 (proxied through nginx)
  • Database: SQLite for user data and preferences (lightweight, no separate container needed)
  • Transcoding: FFmpeg for real-time video conversion

Development uses Docker Compose with hot reloading for both frontend and backend.

docs.title: Technology Stack
docs.text:
Frontend:

  • React 19 with Babel React Compiler
  • Tailwind CSS for styling
  • Video.js 8 for media playback
  • React Router for navigation
  • Custom theming system

Backend:

  • Node.js + Express
  • TypeScript (strict mode, ES2020)
  • Prisma ORM + SQLite
  • JWT authentication
  • FFmpeg integration
  • stashapp-api GraphQL client

docs.title: Configuration
docs.text: Peek Stash Browser is configured through environment variables. This page documents all available configuration options.

docs.title: Required Settings
docs.text:
These environment variables must be set for Peek to function:

Variable Description Example STASH_URL Your Stash GraphQL endpoint http://192.168.1.100:9999/graphql STASH_API_KEY API key from Stash settings eyJhbGciOiJIUzI1NiIsInR5cCI6...

docs.title: Getting Your Stash API Key
docs.text:
1. Open Stash web interface
  2. Navigate to Settings → Security
  3. In the API Key section, click Generate
  4. Copy the generated key
  5. Use this key as STASH_API_KEY

docs.title: Optional Settings
docs.text:
These settings have sensible defaults but can be customized:

Variable Description Default Notes DATABASE_URL SQLite database file file:/app/data/peek-stash-browser.db Path inside container CONFIG_DIR App data directory /app/data Database + HLS cache TMP_DIR Transcoding temp directory /app/tmp Needs fast I/O NODE_ENV Environment mode production development or production JWT_SECRET JWT signing key Auto-generated Generate with openssl rand -hex 32

docs.title: Path Mapping (Advanced)
docs.text:
Peek needs to translate Stash's internal container paths to its own paths:

Variable Description Default When to Change STASH_INTERNAL_PATH Path prefix Stash uses internally /data If Stash uses different mount path STASH_MEDIA_PATH Where Peek accesses Stash's media /app/media Usually keep default

docs.title: Path Mapping Example
docs.text:
If your Stash setup looks like this:

# Stash Docker container
volumes:
  - /mnt/user/videos:/data

Stash will report paths as /data/scenes/video.mp4.

Your Peek configuration should be:

# Peek Docker container
volumes:
  - /mnt/user/videos:/app/media:ro  # Same host path as Stash
environment:
  - STASH_INTERNAL_PATH=/data        # What Stash calls it
  - STASH_MEDIA_PATH=/app/media      # What Peek calls it

This allows Peek to translate:

  • Stash path: /data/scenes/video.mp4
  • To Peek path: /app/media/scenes/video.mp4

docs.title: Security Settings
docs.text:
Variable Description Default When to Use SECURE_COOKIES Enable secure cookie flag false Set to true when using HTTPS reverse proxy JWT_SECRET Secret for JWT token signing Random Generate secure random string for production

Security Best Practices

  • Always change the default admin password
  • Use a strong JWT_SECRET in production
  • Set SECURE_COOKIES=true when using HTTPS
  • Don't expose Peek directly to the internet without a reverse proxy

docs.title: Generating Secure JWT Secret
docs.text:
# Linux/macOS/unRAID
openssl rand -hex 32

# Windows PowerShell
[Convert]::ToBase64String((1..32 | ForEach-Object { Get-Random -Minimum 0 -Maximum 256 }))

docs.title: Minimal Production Configuration
docs.text:
# Required
STASH_URL=http://192.168.1.100:9999/graphql
STASH_API_KEY=your_api_key_here

# All other settings use defaults

docs.title: Complete Production Configuration
docs.text:
# Stash Integration
STASH_URL=http://192.168.1.100:9999/graphql
STASH_API_KEY=your_api_key_here

# Database
DATABASE_URL=file:/app/data/peek-stash-browser.db
CONFIG_DIR=/app/data

# Storage
TMP_DIR=/app/tmp

# Security
JWT_SECRET=your_very_long_random_secret_key_here
SECURE_COOKIES=true

# Path Mapping
STASH_INTERNAL_PATH=/data
STASH_MEDIA_PATH=/app/media

# Environment
NODE_ENV=production

docs.title: Development Configuration
docs.text:
# Stash Integration
STASH_URL=http://localhost:9999/graphql
STASH_API_KEY=your_development_api_key

# Database (local SQLite file)
DATABASE_URL=file:./data/peek-db.db

# Development
NODE_ENV=development
JWT_SECRET=dev-secret-change-in-production

# Path Mapping (for development)
STASH_INTERNAL_PATH=/data
STASH_MEDIA_PATH=/app/media

docs.title: Docker Compose Example
docs.text:
services:
  peek:
    image: carrotwaxr/peek-stash-browser:latest
    container_name: peek-stash-browser
    ports:
      - "6969:80"
    volumes:
      - /mnt/user/videos:/app/media:ro
      - /mnt/user/appdata/peek-stash-browser:/app/data
      - /mnt/user/appdata/peek-stash-browser/tmp:/app/tmp
    environment:
      # Required
      - STASH_URL=http://stash:9999/graphql
      - STASH_API_KEY=${STASH_API_KEY}

      # Optional
      - DATABASE_URL=file:/app/data/peek-db.db
      - JWT_SECRET=${JWT_SECRET}
      - NODE_ENV=production
      - STASH_INTERNAL_PATH=/data
      - STASH_MEDIA_PATH=/app/media
    restart: unless-stopped

docs.title: Cannot Connect to Stash
docs.text:
Check:

  • STASH_URL is accessible from the Peek container
  • STASH_API_KEY is correct and not expired
  • Stash GraphQL API is enabled

Test connectivity:

docker exec peek-stash-browser curl http://your-stash-ip:9999/graphql

docs.title: Videos Won't Play
docs.text:
Check:

  • Media volume is mounted correctly
  • STASH_INTERNAL_PATH matches Stash's mount point
  • STASH_MEDIA_PATH matches Peek's mount point
  • File permissions allow reading

Verify path mapping:

docker exec peek-stash-browser ls -la /app/media

docs.title: Authentication Issues
docs.text:
Check:

  • JWT_SECRET is set
  • SECURE_COOKIES matches your HTTP/HTTPS setup
  • Database is writable

docs.title: Next Steps
docs.text:
• Quick Start Guide
  • Environment Variables Reference
  • Troubleshooting

docs.title: Installation
docs.text: Peek Stash Browser can be deployed in several ways depending on your needs and environment.

docs.title: Prerequisites
docs.text:
Before installing Peek, ensure you have:

  • Stash Server running with GraphQL API enabled
  • Docker installed (Docker Compose only needed for development)
  • Network access from container to Stash server
  • Storage space for SQLite database and transcoding temp files

docs.title: Stash Configuration
docs.text:
1. Enable API in Stash settings
  2. Generate API key in Settings → Security
  3. Note GraphQL endpoint (usually http://stash-ip:9999/graphql)
  4. Ensure network access from your Docker host to Stash

docs.title: Option 1: unRAID (Community Applications)
docs.text:
Easiest Installation Method

This is the recommended method for unRAID users - everything is pre-configured!

  1. Install from Community Applications:
  2. Search for "Peek Stash Browser" in unRAID's Community Applications
  3. Click install and configure your settings
  4. Access at http://your-unraid-ip:6969

For detailed unRAID setup instructions, see the unRAID Deployment Guide.

docs.title: Option 2: Docker (Single Container)
docs.text:
Recommended for Production

Single container includes everything - frontend, backend, and database

docker run -d \
  --name peek-stash-browser \
  -p 6969:80 \
  -v /path/to/your/media:/app/media:ro \
  -v /path/to/peek-stash-browser/data:/app/data \
  -v /path/to/peek-stash-browser/tmp:/app/tmp \
  -e STASH_URL="http://your-stash-server:9999/graphql" \
  -e STASH_API_KEY="your_stash_api_key" \
  carrotwaxr/peek-stash-browser:latest

Volume Mounts:

  • /path/to/your/media - Your media files (read-only)
  • /path/to/peek-stash-browser/data - Database and app data
  • /path/to/peek-stash-browser/tmp - Transcoding temporary files

Required Environment Variables:

  • STASH_URL - Your Stash GraphQL endpoint
  • STASH_API_KEY - API key from Stash settings

See Configuration Guide for all environment variables.

docs.title: Option 3: Docker Compose (Development)
docs.text:
For Development Only

This method is for development with hot reloading enabled

  1. Clone and setup:
git clone https://github.com/carrotwaxr/peek-stash-browser.git
cd peek-stash-browser
cp .env.example .env
  1. Configure environment (edit .env):
STASH_URL=http://your-stash-server:9999/graphql
STASH_API_KEY=your_stash_api_key
DATABASE_URL=file:./data/peek-stash-browser.db
TMP_DIR=/path/to/temp/directory
  1. Start services:
docker-compose up -d
  1. Access the app: Open http://localhost:6969

For development setup details, see the Development Setup Guide.

docs.title: First Access
docs.text:
After installation, access Peek in your browser:

  1. Navigate to http://localhost:6969 (or your server IP)
  2. Default login credentials:
  3. Username: admin
  4. Password: admin
  5. ⚠️ Important: Change password immediately after first login!

docs.title: Port Configuration
docs.text:
Environment Port Service Description Production 6969 Complete App nginx serves frontend + proxies API Development 6969 Frontend UI Vite dev server with hot reloading Development 8000 Backend API Express server (internal Docker network)

Production uses only one port!

Production deployment exposes only port 6969 - nginx handles everything internally

docs.title: Hardware Recommendations
docs.text: Component Minimum Recommended CPU 2 cores 4+ cores (for multiple transcoding streams) RAM 2GB 4GB+ Storage SSD for database SSD for database, network storage for media Network 100 Mbps Gigabit (for 4K content)

docs.title: Quick Start
docs.text: Get Peek up and running in 5 minutes!

docs.title: Step 1: Install Peek
docs.text:
Docker (Fastest)unRAID 
docker run -d \
  --name peek-stash-browser \
  -p 6969:80 \
  -v /path/to/media:/app/media:ro \
  -v /path/to/peek/data:/app/data \
  -e STASH_URL="http://your-stash:9999/graphql" \
  -e STASH_API_KEY="your_api_key" \
  carrotwaxr/peek-stash-browser:latest
  1. Search "Peek Stash Browser" in Community Applications
  2. Click Install
  3. Configure Stash URL and API key
  4. Click Apply

== "Docker Compose"

```bash
git clone https://github.com/carrotwaxr/peek-stash-browser.git
cd peek-stash-browser
cp .env.example .env
# Edit .env with your settings
docker-compose up -d
```

docs.title: Step 2: First Login
docs.text:
1. Open browser: http://localhost:6969 (or your server IP)
  2. Login with default credentials:
  3. Username: admin
  4. Password: admin

Change Password Immediately

The default password is well-known. Change it immediately in Settings!

docs.title: Step 3: Browse Your Library
docs.text:
• Scenes: Browse all your video content
  • Performers: View performers and their scenes
  • Studios: Explore by production company
  • Tags: Find content by tags

docs.title: Step 4: Watch Videos
docs.text:
1. Click any scene to view details
  2. Click Play to start video
  3. Quality automatically adjusts based on network
  4. Use timeline to seek through video

docs.title: Step 5: Create Playlists
docs.text:
1. Click Playlists in navigation
  2. Click Create Playlist
  3. Enter name and description
  4. Add scenes by clicking the + icon on any scene
  5. Play your playlist with shuffle/repeat options!

docs.title: Change Admin Password
docs.text:
1. Click user icon (top right)
  2. Select Settings
  3. Enter new password
  4. Click Save

docs.title: Create Additional Users
docs.text:
1. Go to Users (admin only)
  2. Click Create User
  3. Enter username, email, password
  4. Select role (Admin or User)
  5. Click Create

docs.title: Configure Theme
docs.text:
1. Click theme toggle icon (moon/sun)
  2. Choose Dark or Light mode
  3. Theme preference is saved automatically

docs.title: Video Playback Tips
docs.text:
• Direct Play: If browser supports the format, plays directly (no transcoding)
  • Transcoded: HLS streaming with adaptive quality when needed
  • Seeking: Full timeline scrubbing works in both modes
  • Quality: Click quality button to manually select resolution

docs.title: Keyboard Shortcuts
docs.text: Key Action Space Play/Pause ← Seek backward 10s → Seek forward 10s ↑ Volume up ↓ Volume down F Toggle fullscreen M Mute/unmute

docs.title: Can't Login
docs.text:
• Check container logs: docker logs peek-stash-browser
  • Verify database was created in /app/data
  • Ensure JWT_SECRET is set (or auto-generated)

docs.title: No Scenes Showing
docs.text:
• Check STASH_URL is correct
  • Verify STASH_API_KEY is valid
  • Test Stash connectivity from container: 
    docker exec peek-stash-browser curl http://your-stash:9999/graphql

docs.title: Videos Won't Play
docs.text:
• Verify media path is mounted correctly: 
    docker exec peek-stash-browser ls /app/media
  • Check path mapping configuration
  • Ensure FFmpeg is installed (included in official image)
